definition: to dislike/suspicion/resentment/enmity/abbr. for 嫌犯[xian2 fan4], criminal suspect
double/twice/simultaneous/holding two or more (official) posts at the same time
to be a suspect (in a crime)/to be suspected of
to favor the rich and disdain the poor (idiom)/snobbish
more than one would wish/somewhat/a bit too (old, contrived, distracting etc)

sentences.english: Small smacks on the bottom are always a good way to start.
sentences.chinese: 小之嫌於底部，都是一個很好的方法開始。

sentences.english: A lover can never have enough of the solaces of his beloved.
sentences.chinese: 來自所愛之人的安慰再多，情人也不嫌。

sentences.english: I quite liked the story, but I thought the ending was rather contrived.
sentences.chinese: 我挺喜歡這個故事，不過我覺得結尾頗有斧鑿之嫌。

sentences.english: But if that's too much of a commute, try Eastbourne.
sentences.chinese: 如果你嫌那裏上下班人流過大，可以試試去伊斯特本。

sentences.english: Hospitalize immediately if pump malfunction suspected.
sentences.chinese: 泵發生故障時立即住院之嫌。

sentences.english: After three day both fist and guest become offensive.
sentences.chinese: 魚放三日有臭氣，客住三日遭人嫌。

sentences.english: Content to bloom in native bower, Although the place be small.
sentences.chinese: 不嫌自己園亭狹小，願意努力開花。

sentences.english: A guy who's here for now can barely be bothered with a text.
sentences.chinese: “愛一時”的男人連發短信都嫌麻煩。

sentences.english: He that once deceived is never suspected.
sentences.chinese: 一次行詐騙，永遠遇疑嫌。

sentences.english: Nothing more than boxes of iron, too small for standing or lying.
sentences.chinese: 它們不比一個鐵箱子大，站直或躺着都嫌太小。

sentences.english: You're polluting the entire solar system.
sentences.chinese: 連丟進太陽系都嫌你不夠環保。

sentences.english: Guests, like fish, begin to smell after three days.
sentences.chinese: 魚放三天臭，客住三天嫌。

sentences.english: He always scolds me, disrelish me study is bad, often also do not come home.
sentences.chinese: 他總是罵我，嫌我學習不好，也經常不回家。

sentences.english: "I'm afraid not, " was the confession. "It's too strong for the magazines.
sentences.chinese: “怕是賣不掉，”他承認，“投給雜誌嫌太激烈。

sentences.english: I think your choice of a successor savors of favoritism.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲你對繼承人的選擇有偏袒之嫌。

sentences.english: Such a legal sentence is too light and is suspected of being indulgent with the degenerates.
sentences.chinese: 這一罪名的法定刑太輕，有放縱那些腐敗分子之嫌。

definition: to be afraid/to fear/to dread/to be unable to endure/perhaps
to complain/to grumble/to harbor a complaint/to feel dissatisfied
firmly set on doing sth/to insist on doing/determined in one's course of action
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
(usu used in the negative) to be of importance or to matter/to be in the way/to be a hindrance
to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy
